documentation.text:
@title Minimal ERC20 interface for Uniswap
 @notice Contains a subset of the full ERC20 interface that is used in Uniswap V3

@dev Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the
 name.

@dev Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation.
 For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should
 be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).
 Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between
 Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is
 overridden;
 NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in
 no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including
 {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

attributes.text:
@title Minimal ERC20 interface for Uniswap
 @notice Contains a subset of the full ERC20 interface that is used in Uniswap V3

@dev Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the
 name.

@dev Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation.
 For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should
 be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).
 Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between
 Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is
 overridden;
 NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in
 no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including
 {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

params.owner: The account that approved spending of its tokens
params.spender: The account for which the spending allowance was modified
params.value: The new allowance from the owner to the spender

params.from: The account from which the tokens were sent, i.e. the balance decreased
params.to: The account to which the tokens were sent, i.e. the balance increased
params.value: The amount of tokens that were transferred

params.owner: The account of the token owner
params.spender: The account of the token spender

returns._0: The current allowance granted by `owner` to `spender`

params.amount: The amount of tokens allowed to be used by `spender`
params.spender: The account which will be allowed to spend a given amount of the owners tokens

returns._0: Returns true for a successful approval, false for unsuccessful

params.account: The account for which to look up the number of tokens it has, i.e. its balance

returns._0: The number of tokens held by the account

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

params.amount: The number of tokens to send from the sender to the recipient
params.recipient: The account that will receive the amount transferred

returns._0: Returns true for a successful transfer, false for an unsuccessful transfer

params.sender: The account from which the transfer will be initiated

returns._0: Returns true for a successful transfer, false for unsuccessful

Approval(address,address,uint256).notice: Event emitted when the approval amount for the spender of a given owner's tokens changes.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).notice: Event emitted when tokens are transferred from one address to another, either via `#transfer` or `#transferFrom`.

allowance(address,address).notice: Returns the current allowance given to a spender by an owner

approve(address,uint256).notice: Sets the allowance of a spender from the `msg.sender` to the value `amount`

balanceOf(address).notice: Returns the balance of a token

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfers the amount of token from the `msg.sender` to the recipient

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfers `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` up to the allowance given to the `msg.sender`

userdoc.notice: Contains a subset of the full ERC20 interface that is used in Uniswap V3
